Prompt: In United States v. Joint Traffic Association (1898), what was the opinion of the Court?
Response: The Court held that Congress has the power to prohibit contracts of the nature involved in this case, and that the citizen may have the right to make a proper (that is, a lawful) contract, one which is also essential and necessary for carrying out his lawful purposes. The Court also held that Congress may restrain individuals from making contracts under certain circumstances and upon certain subjects.
